extends BaseSystemDelegate
implements ICapabilities

    • Method Detail

      • getOrientationDefault

        public ICapabilitiesOrientation getOrientationDefault()
        Obtains the default orientation of the device/display. If no default orientation is available on the platform, this method will return the current orientation. To capture device or display orientation changes please use the IDevice and IDisplay functions and listeners API respectively.
        Specified by:
        getOrientationDefault in interface ICapabilities
        Returns:
        The default orientation for the device/display.
        Since:
        v2.0.5

      • getOrientationsSupported

        public ICapabilitiesOrientation[] getOrientationsSupported()
        Provides the device/display orientations supported by the platform. A platform will usually support at least one orientation. This is usually PortaitUp.
        Specified by:
        getOrientationsSupported in interface ICapabilities
        Returns:
        The orientations supported by the device/display of the platform.
        Since:
        v2.0.5

        Returns:
